page.title: 11TOURISM
page.content: {TOURISM IN THE DUNSMORE AREA In 1892 the railway was extended from Chalfont to Wendover thus bringing the first tourists to the area. There are many beautiful walks to enjoy including the Ridgeway Path and the Inknield Way. Coombe Hill 848ft above sea_level, is dedicated as a National Nature Reserve and is the site of Britain's first public nature trail. The dome of St Paul's Cathedral can be seen on a clear day from the summit. Annualy a Cross Country Race is held from Wendover village to the top of Coombe Hill and back, attracting many spectators. The Prime Minister's residence of Chequers is nearby and is a 'must' for tourists, although not open to the public. Horse Trials at Russell Farm occasionaly have royal entrants and are well supported.
